name: TheAtlantic
text: The "bronies," adult fans of the children's TV show "My Little Pony," have tacitly allowed white supremacists into their ranks for years. But following Black Lives Matter protests, they're finally waking up, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/AzZyV5iFrv

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coronavirus outbreak has emboldened defenders of the nation-state, in Europe and beyond, @RachelDonadio writes: https://t.co/4VEYdCzS7U

text: Domestic abuse victims are worried that virtual visitations could give their abusers an intimate glimpse of their homes and even allow them to identify their locations, @AdminKlein writes: https://t.co/XJmetatMkl

text: “I’m worried about my daughter driving, but I wouldn’t keep her home because there’s a one-out-of-a-million chance that she’s gonna die in a car accident.” @olgakhazan reports on the public-health experts who want to reopen schools: https://t.co/3KaHwL68rA

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: Carly Fiorina told @IsaacDovere "that this struggle is one Republicans need to have—including those who have rationalized supporting Trump despite their disagreements, because of some of his policies or judicial appointments." https://t.co/TCHjAGNtJh

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PeterAtlantic: Dovere: You were Ted Cruz’s running mate. When was the last time you talked to him?

Fiorina: Several years ago. https://t.co/lMr0Q6uvBW

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ Four years ago, Fiorina voted for Trump—even after he’d mocked her by saying, “Look at that face! Would anyone vote for that? Can you imagine that, the face of our next president?” She won’t do that again. https://t.co/jCYLnohm6l

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/ “I’ve been very clear that I can’t support Donald Trump,” she told @IsaacDovere, arguing that Republicans who sa… https://t.co/c361x6UfRQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: 4/ As for her former running mate, Ted Cruz, who’s turned into an avid Trump defender—she said she hasn’t spoken wi… https://t.co/NrFC9m8mQD

name: TheAtlantic
text: 5/ It hasn’t been an easy decision, especially when Fiorina thinks about issues that she cares deeply about, such as limiting government spending and restricting abortion. Read the rest of her interview with @IsaacDovere here: https://t.co/jCYLnohm6l

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coronavirus surge in the Sun Belt could further alienate urban and suburban voters from Trump and the GOP, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/3WWY32addf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: In AZ, "The pressure on local medical workers is growing so intense that Ross Goldberg, the president of the Arizona Medical Association, told me the state may soon need to ask for volunteer health-care professionals from other states, as New York did earlier this year. " https://t.co/gvJebVl3f3

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: .@ashleyfetters has put her finger on a big reason daily life feels so weird right now: in some ways life feels like the past, in some ways it feels like the future. We’re living in the retrofuture, essentially:
https://t.co/IksSGkcQi4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We are public servants. We should reflect the populations we represent. That’s the way you get the best ideas," @marydalyecon tells @AnnieLowrey: https://t.co/XTmCRHgBbB

name: TheAtlantic
text: How Kayleigh McEnany, an ardent defender of faith—and Donald Trump—came to think of the press as her enemy. @EmmaOGreen on the White House press secretary: https://t.co/MT9jplrzu3

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "McEnany is a skillful steward of the covenant between the president and his religious supporters, openly suggesting that reporters stand among America’s enemies, no matter how much that may beggar belief." https://t.co/ddYPx51w3z

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AnnieLowrey: SF Fed President @marydalyecon doesn't want it to take another decade to get to full employment. My interview with her on monetary policy, inclusive growth, and this horrible recession: https://t.co/yzg74tNQEF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @katejulian: 1/ Since the pandemic started, there’s been lots of discussion of HOW to talk to kids about wrenching topics. What’s missing is WHY it’s essential. Short answer: They aren’t stupid. Research shows blindfolding doesn't work & actually hurts kids--and us. https://t.co/wG8bzTbXQY

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch Live: Staff writer @AnneApplebaum joins editor in chief @jeffreygoldberg for a live discussion about the history of corrupt regimes, including why Republican leaders have abandoned their principles in support of an immoral president. https://t.co/YNMdIReezt

name: TheAtlantic
text: On Wednesday, the U.S. reported more than 38,600 new cases of the coronavirus, the highest daily total of the pandemic so far. A new and brutal stage of the outbreak now menaces the South and West, @yayitsrob and @alexismadrigal report. https://t.co/GQXHn3yNO3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Chinese Exclusion Cases have never been overruled, which is what allowed the Court to rely on the ideas they expressed. As long as these cases remain good precedent, administrations will be tempted to embrace them," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/prievUPdn2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TomMcTague: “To listen to an Atlanta rapper address a press conference, or a Houston police chief speak to a crowd of protesters, is to watch a more accomplished, powerful, and eloquent public speaker than almost any European politician.” https://t.co/sLNvMfWjEL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Slotting well-paid, highly pedigreed women into corporate America’s existing power structures was never going to end workplace abuses, writes @amandamull https://t.co/cOOnZ4ggcC

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @slaskow: "So much for the fears of a resurgence in the fall. The virus has not gone away with warm weather.... It has gotten worse."

It's hard to express how badly the U.S. has bungled this, but @yayitsrob and @alexismadrigal are doing it:

https://t.co/LUUiOdZoRw

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers may have captured, for the first time, the flare from a faraway cosmic collision, @marinakoren reports. https://t.co/zOGNWBOcns

name: TheAtlantic
text:
